attributes.action: crack down on unjustifiable discrimination and create genuine routes through which young people can obtain cheaper motor-vehicle insurance.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As a 17 year-old male, living in suburban Yorkshire, the cheapest quote for third-party insurance I can obtain, on a £2500 group 1 car, is £1700. My experience is common amongst young people.

Insurers who discount for Pass Plus mostly charge more expensive premiums in the first place; in addition to the cost of obtaining Pass Plus this negates the discount.

Some brokers offer significantly cheaper insurance that is invalid for late-night journeys. These offers are unavailable to the youngest drivers.

The majority need ways to prove less risk is presented than the minority who do drive dangerously and/or break the law.

Suggestions:

Force brokers to not discriminate unjustifiably and so extend offers of 'Pay-As-You-Drive' and limited-hours insurance to people of all ages.

Force brokers to discount insurance if we allow speed-limiters/speed recording devices/breathalysers to be fitted in our vehicles to prove we don't break the law.

Subsidise insurance on group 1 vehicles which are the least dangerous and most economical.

Create a new qualification to prove mastery of advanced driving skills, and force brokers to offer significant discounts if it is obtained.
